column1: Medicines that can affect the test results include: - Chlorpromazine - Corticosteroids - Phenacemide - Salicylates - Some kinds of antibiotics - Tolbutamide
This test is done to look at globulin proteins in the blood.
Gamma globulines include various types of antibodies such as immunoglobulins (Ig) M, G, and A.
For example, Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia is a cancer of certain white blood cells that is associated with the overproduction IgM antibodies.
